paper_abstract: In this study, a new vector modulator topology is presented. The modulator is composed by two "balanced-load" biphase modulators. The balanced load is a novel principle allowing a topological simplification of commonly adopted vector modulator schemes: seven couplers are used instead of the 9 ones in traditional reflection-type modulators, with comparable performance. The measured results of monolithic 45-65 GHz test vehicles of the methodology for both biphase and vector modulators, are presented. (c) 2009 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Int J RF and Microwave CAE 20: 103-113, 2010.
paper_title: A Novel Broadband MMIC Vector Modulator for V-Band Applications
